jobs.title: Développeur·se Back-end Python Sénior H/F
jobs.description:
Paris (FR)

Octopus Energy France 🇫🇷 – OE Engineering /

Full-time /

Hybrid

 

Rejoins la révolution énergétique

Tu aimes les défis et tu as envie d’avoir un vrai impact ? Rejoins-nous !

Qui sommes-nous ?

Octopus Energy France est une scale-up engagée et en pleine croissance dans le domaine de l’énergie. En trois ans, nous sommes devenus le cinquième fournisseur français !

Notre mission ? Fournir une énergie moins chère et plus verte à tous les Français, ainsi que des solutions concrètes pour accélérer la transition écologique.

Nous plaçons l’innovation, la transparence et l’excellence au centre de notre modèle. Grâce à notre plateforme Kraken, notre expertise en data et nos équipes, nous accompagnons nos client·es vers un avenir à faible émission de CO₂, tout en leur permettant de réaliser des économies.

Nous déployons un modèle innovant de service client qui permet de proposer une expérience unique pour les clients et pour les équipes d'Octopus Energy. Convaincus que la relation client est un levier clé pour accélérer la transition énergétique, nous travaillons au quotidien pour allier excellence opérationnelle et impact positif.

La preuve ? Nous sommes la marque la mieux notée parmi les fournisseurs d’énergie Français sur Google Reviews et Trustpilot.

Ce que tu feras ?

Tu travailleras pour une entreprise qui lutte contre le changement climatique au quotidien : en tant que fournisseur, nous aidons les gens à utiliser des technologies plus vertes et les énergies renouvelables, tout en contribuant à faire évoluer le marché français vers un avenir plus sobre en carbone.

Nous avons beaucoup de challenges et de défis de conception difficiles à résoudre. Le marché français de l'énergie est compliqué, obsolète et lourd de processus - il y a énormément de modélisations de domaine que nous devons réussir. Une grande attention aux détails est ainsi essentielle.

Nous recherchons un·e développeur·se backend sénior (à partir de 5/6 ans d'expérience en développement) pour rejoindre l'équipe Octopus Energy Engineering France. En développement continu, l'équipe travaille en étroite collaboration avec les différentes équipes métiers et produits françaises pour les aider à innover et poursuivre notre croissance dans les années à venir !

Notre vision “orientée client” est au cœur de tous nos projets et de toutes nos priorités et l'équipe sera elle-aussi organisée autour de cette vision, ce qui se traduit au quotidien par des priorités qui changent parfois et de l'ambiguïté. Mais il résulte de cette organisation de très nombreux retours et la possibilité d’avancer vite tout en continuant de tester différentes choses, ce qui est une source de motivation importante pour nous.

Tu pourras par exemple travailler sur des projets de pointe tels que les éco-sessions, qui a rapporté à nos client·es plusieurs dizaines de milliers d’euros en 2024, ou l’Octopus Fan Club, projet qui vise à récompenser les client·es vivant à proximité de nos éoliennes et que nous avons commencé à déployer en France. Si tu recherches un environnement dynamique et gratifiant où ton travail a un impact réel, alors tu t’intégreras parfaitement dans notre équipe.

Notre organisation et notre vision privilégient les hiérarchies “horizontales”, ainsi qu’une culture de travail ouverte et agile qui favorise l'innovation, la flexibilité et la créativité. Chez Octopus, nous embauchons des personnes formidables qui font avancer les choses, tout en restant eux-mêmes !

Nous recherchons une expérience/expertise dans les domaines suivants :

PythonDjango (ou web framework équivalent)Domain modellingHTTP et REST APIsRédaction de code robuste et résistant aux erreurs Celery et async processingPostgresMaitrise du Français et de l'Anglais


Une expérience dans les domaines suivants peut être un plus :

AWSTerraform, Packer, ConsulReact and ReduxNous recherchons avant tout quelqu'un avec un intérêt pour la technologie en général et surtout qui soit "orienté résultat", capable de travailler avec de nombreux interlocuteurs et de faire preuve de réactivité et d'innovation.


Pourquoi tu vas adorer travailler chez nous ? 

Tu te demandes quel est le salaire pour ce poste ? Demande-le nous ! Lors de notre premier contact, c’est un point que nous abordons toujours, car nous souhaitons réellement faire correspondre ton expérience avec le bon salaire. La raison pour laquelle nous n’en parlons pas ici est que nous avons un certain degré de flexibilité et que nous ne voudrions jamais que le salaire soit une raison pour laquelle quelqu’un.e ne postule pas chez Octopus - ce qui est plus important pour nous est de trouver le bon octofit !

Octopus Energy France a été classé quatrième sur plus de 200 entreprises au classement Great Place to Work ! Cela reflète bien notre engagement pour un environnement de travail épanouissant !

Nous sommes une organisation où les gens apprennent, décident et construisent plus rapidement. Où ils travaillent de manière autonome, avec des gens extraordinaires, sur des projets qui innovent. Intéressement au capital, flex-office, excellente mutuelle, forfait mobilité douce, prise en charge d’une partie du pass navigo au delà du minimum légal, et même des jours de congés spéciaux pour t’investir dans un projet associatif qui te tient à coeur… nous voulons que ton investissement soit récompensé par des avantages auxquels tu tiens vraiment !

Chez Octopus, nous cherchons des personnes foncièrement bienveillantes et empathiques. L’égalité des chances nous tient à cœur et nous veillons à offrir un environnement de travail inclusif et équitable. Nous t’invitons à postuler, quels que soient ton âge, genre, vie conjugale, couleur, handicap, grossesse ou parentalité, origine, convictions religieuses ou orientation sexuelle.

Si tout cela te stimule, postule dès maintenant !

jobs.title: Prompt Engineer (M/W/NB)
jobs.description:
Company Description

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin’s Creed, Rainbow Six to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you’re passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft's pioneering studio, Paris studio was responsible for the publisher's first successes following its creation in 1992. Today, it is at the helm of such must-have licenses as Just Dance, Ghost Recon and Mario + The Rabbids. Ubisoft Paris has also built a solid reputation as a partner of choice in cross-studio collaborations such as Watch Dogs, Skull & Bones, Beyond Good & Evil 2 and Star Wars. Building on this experience, the studio continues to push the boundaries of creativity by working on some very promising yet unannounced projects.

With 750 talents of 35 nationalities, Ubisoft Paris is today the largest studio in France and one of the most experienced in the industry. Young talents can benefit from the strong presence of senior profiles in the creative, technical or artistic fields. Everyone is driven by the same passion: to push the limits of what is possible and to offer new experiences to our players.

Ready to join the adventure? Join us at the Paris Studio!

Job Description

In this role, you’ll join a team developing a tech product designed to integrate AI features into our games. Within our production studios, you’ll work at the intersection of AI, design, and quality assurance teams—allowing you to bring your expertise in prompt engineering and AI to create unique gaming experiences.

As a Prompt Engineer (M/W/NB), your responsibilities will include:


Participating in the scoping and design of AI-driven game features;Ensuring the technology is accessible and usable by different departments;Guaranteeing prompt content consistency across environments by testing how changes impact performance (error correction, divergence detection, rewording and clarification), while aiming to optimize latency and cost;Helping define and promote best practices for prompt engineering and supporting teams in implementing them;Contributing to the creation of both manual and automated test scenarios in collaboration with QA and AI teams;Analyzing bugs and feedback, identifying those related to prompt content, and suggesting improvements;Helping identify and test new machine learning models, as well as designing tools to support their use;Staying up to date on the latest in prompt engineering and AI research.


Qualifications


Passionate about video games, with at least one prior experience in a tech company;Proven experience designing prompts for various tasks and across multiple providers. You’re familiar with concepts like agents and function calling, reasoning strategies, chain/tree of thought approaches, zero-shot & few-shot learning, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG);Solid understanding of several language models (GPT-4, Gemini, Claude, Qwen, SentenceBERT, Llama, Mistral, etc.) and their key differences;Fluent in both English, written and spoken (French is a plus). You are also known for your strong writing skills;Strong listening and comprehension skills, with the ability to translate user needs into clear specifications;Capable of adapting your analysis and communication style to reach a wide range of stakeholders;Independent and curious by nature.


Bonus points for:


Programming skills (Python, C#, etc.) and experience working with AI APIs;Experience in narrative content creation (dialogue, quests, world-building) and/or role-playing games;A good understanding of video game design principles.


When reviewing applications, particular attention will be paid to the quality of the cover letter. We will favor a concise text that demonstrates a clear understanding of the position and highlights one or two well-targeted experiences and/or skills, rather than a long, generic letter that simply reiterates your résumé.

Additional Information

Joining us means having access from day one to:


Flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotely up to two days per week, in accordance with Ubisoft’s remote work policy;20 days of remote work per year from a European Union country (eligibility limited to EU citizens);Our internal e-learning platform to finally train on the tools you’ve always wanted to master;Our game library where you can borrow the latest Ubisoft titles, competitor games, consoles, and board games;Our works council (CSE) offering discounted rates on a wide range of shows, cinemas, concerts, gyms, amusement parks, and many other great deals.


And after one year?


You’ll have a career and development plan established with your manager, along with clear goals to help you grow each year;You’ll have joined one of our clubs: choir, yoga, tennis, lightsaber… or even created your own!You’ll enjoy your 1.5-hour lunch break by taking a class in our gym or borrowing one of our bikes for a ride in the Bois de Vincennes;You’ll be looking forward to the next surf/yoga or ski weekend organized by the CSE;You’ll have become unbeatable at foosball, climbing, Just Dance, or Boomerang Fu;You’ll have raided the internal sale to complete your collection of Ubisoft goodies and games (because you can never have too many).


Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer and offers all individuals the same access to employment, regardless of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability, or age. Ubisoft is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of its player community.

Check out this guide to help you with your application, and learn about our actions to encourage more diversity and inclusion.

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.description:
Job Title: Data EngineerLocation: Paris, France (Le Marais neighborhood)Entity: The Redesign Group FRDepartment: Redesign AI Work Arrangement: On-site
The Redesign Group is a global business, design and technology consultancy specializing in transformational services that help organizations achieve their potential. 
We're expanding our newly formed Redesign AI team to help small to mid-sized businesses adopt AI engine technologies. 
As a Data Engineer, you'll be responsible for assisting our Product Development team with making strategic data sources available to models, LLMs and Agents for a variety of business use cases. 
At Redesign, we believe the future belongs to the curious. Join us to help build emerging cognitive architecture that enables curiosity to flourish within the workplace. 

Job Summary:As a Senior Data Engineer, you will design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and workflows to support our growing data ecosystem. You will focus on creating production-ready ETL processes using Apache Airflow, integrating with diverse data stores, and ensuring all code meets rigorous development standards, including peer review, scalability, and comprehensive test coverage. The ideal candidate is a proficient developer who treats data engineering as software engineering, with hands-on experience in RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) pipelines and a track record of delivering reliable, maintainable systems.
Key Responsibilities:Develop and optimize ETL pipelines using Apache Airflow to ingest, transform, and load data from various sources into target systems.Implement production-ready code for data workflows, ensuring scalability, fault tolerance, and adherence to best practices such as modular design, error handling, and automated testing (unit, integration, and end-to-end).Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and engineering teams to build and maintain RAG pipelines that enhance AI/ML applications with accurate, context-aware data retrieval.Participate in code reviews to enforce high coding standards, promote clean, readable code, and integrate CI/CD practices for automated testing and deployment.Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines for performance, reliability, and data quality, implementing observability tools to detect and resolve issues proactively.Design and optimize data storage solutions, integrating with relational and NoSQL databases to support real-time and batch processing needs.Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).5+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role, with a proven background as a strong developer (e.g., proficiency in Python, SQL, and related languages).Excellent proficiency with Apache Airflow for orchestrating complex ETL workflows, including DAG creation, scheduling, and dependency management.Demonstrated experience building scalable ETL pipelines that handle large datasets, with a focus on production-ready implementation including comprehensive test coverage (e.g., using pytest or similar frameworks).Strong emphasis on software engineering practices: Experience with peer code reviews, version control (e.g., Git), and ensuring code is modular, documented, and scalable to prevent common pitfalls like brittle or unmaintainable pipelines.Familiarity with data modeling, transformation, and integration in distributed environments.Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with RAG pipelines, including vector databases and embedding techniques for AI-driven applications.Hands-on experience with databases such as PostgreSQL (for relational data), StarRocks (for analytical workloads), Cassandra or ScyllaDB (for high-throughput NoSQL), and Qdrant (for vector search).Knowledge of cloud data services (e.g., AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory) and orchestration tools beyond Airflow.Familiarity with monitoring and observability tools like Prometheus or OpenSearch for data pipeline health.Certifications in relevant technologies (e.g., Apache Airflow)

jobs.title: Paid Acquisition Manager (with Creative Strategy Expertise)

Founded in 2021 by Eva and Solène, two sisters diagnosed with PCOS, SOVA was born from frustration with the lack of solutions available. Today, we are transforming that frustration into action. With +200% growth in the past year, scaling from €1M to €3M in profitable revenue, we are now targeting €7M in 2025 with a major international expansion.
SOVA develops high-quality supplements in collaboration with leading experts, trusted and recommended by healthcare professionals.

Landing Page Creation & OptimizationCreate and optimize high-converting landing pages, advertorials, and listicles aligned with campaign objectives.Work closely with design and content teams to ensure pages are brand-aligned and conversion-focused.Conduct A/B tests on headlines, layouts, CTAs, and product positioning to maximize conversion rates.Implement a continuous improvement loop based on analytics and user behavior data.
Experimentation & GrowthExplore and test emerging channels (Snapchat, Reddit, native ads) to diversify acquisition sources.Run A/B tests at every stage of the funnel—from ad copy to landing pages and checkout flow.Identify and act on opportunities to improve conversion rates post-click.
Performance Analysis & ReportingMonitor and analyze key KPIs (ROAS, CPA, CTR, CVR, creative fatigue rates).Produce actionable weekly/monthly reports and insights for the leadership team.Recommend budget reallocations and strategy shifts based on data.

The CRM Manager is a core player in EMF Media’s Retention & CRM team, owning the development, optimisation, and execution of email, SMS, and push marketing strategies across all lifecycle stages.His role blends performance marketing with automation strategy and creative collaboration to drive customer acquisition, repeat purchases, maximisation of lifetime value (LTV), and reduction of churn. Key Responsibilities
1. CRM Strategy & ExecutionBuild, own, and evolve full-funnel CRM roadmaps for our e-commerce clients, ensuring lifecycle strategies are tailored to each brand’s growth stage, customer behaviours, and retention goals.
Manage the CRM content calendar in alignment with brand priorities and marketing campaigns.Lead the strategy and execution of automated lifecycle flows, ensuring each step is delivered by the right stakeholders (copy, design, dev) and aligned with performance goals.Oversee SMS and push notification strategies as complementary retention touchpoints.Align CRM and acquisition strategies to ensure journey continuity, while establishing and tracking performance KPIs across each client account.

Define advanced segmentation strategies based on user behaviour, purchase patterns, and lifecycle stage.Implement AI-powered tools for dynamic content, personalised recommendations, and conditional logic.Continuously refine segments based on performance feedback and predictive models.Build scalable personalisation frameworks for email, SMS, and push notifications.
3. Performance Tracking & OptimisationLet performance insights drive your next iteration.
Track and optimise CRM KPIS to ensure they consistently meet performance goals and contribute to client account growth.Run structured A/B tests on subject lines, design, timing, and messaging.Build and maintain reporting dashboards for ongoing optimisation.Leverage insights to refine CRM strategy, align internal teams, and deliver clear reporting and strategic updates to clients.
4. Automation & Tech Stack ManagementBuild a smart, scalable, and reliable CRM infrastructure.
Create and manage flows in platforms like Klaviyo.Ensure clean integrations between CRM, and analytics environments.Implement predictive send times, AI-driven product blocks, and custom event triggers.Maintain compliance, deliverability, and responsiveness across all devices and inboxes.
5. Cross-Team Collaboration & Creative BriefingOperate as the connector between content, strategy, and execution.
Collaborate with Copywriters and Designers to produce high-converting, brand-aligned content.Own the briefing process for CRM assets and campaign messaging.Sync with Performance Managers to align CRM goals with launch calendars and growth pushes.Support ecommerce and retention strategies with customer-first storytelling and dynamic loyalty messaging.
Ideal Candidate Profile
3–5 years of experience in CRM, lifecycle marketing, or retention strategy within a DTC or e-commerce environment.If from a brand-side background, the company must have generated between €1M and €50M in annual revenue, ideally with high growth velocity.Proven hands-on experience with platforms like Klaviyo or similar CRM tools.Strong understanding of customer segmentation, automated lifecycle flows, and email/SMS strategy focused on performance.An analytical mindset with the ability to extract actionable insights from data and continuously improve results.Comfortable managing CRM campaigns end-to-end, from planning and execution to testing and reporting.Strong project management and cross-functional communication skills, especially with creative and performance marketing teams.Experience working with wellness, beauty, or lifestyle brands is mandatory.

What We Offer
Join a High-Performance TeamBe part of a fast-growing and impact-driven agency, working alongside top-tier talent focused on results.Remote & Flexible WorkWork from anywhere in France while connecting with a collaborative, high-energy team.Career Growth & LearningAccess continuous opportunities to expand your expertise, take on new responsibilities, and accelerate your career trajectory.Collaborative CultureBe part of a team that values efficiency, transparency, and shared success, where everyone contributes to collective performance.Competitive CompensationReceive a salary that reflects your skills and experience, complemented by performance-based bonuses.
Our Recruitment Process
Our hiring process is designed to assess both strategic depth and operational excellence, ensuring a strong mutual fit from day one.
Initial ApplicationA short form to understand your background, mindset, and creative approach. HR InterviewA 30-minute conversation focused on your career path, role expectations, and fit with our mission. Technical InterviewA 60-minute deep dive with your future manager, including a live technical test to assess your creative frameworks, processes, and real-time decision-making. The SprintA 4 week, part-time collaboration with the team you may join.The Sprint helps both sides validate real-world collaboration before moving forward. jobs.title: Senior Editorial Content Manager
jobs.description:
Brief Info About Vinted

Vinted is the leading second-hand fashion marketplace in Europe and a go-to destination for all kinds of second-hand items. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 60 carriers and more than 500,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace, Vinted Go, and Vinted Pay is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. Its backers include Accel, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Sprints, and TPG.

Information About The Position

Do you know how to craft a story? Can you help us elevate our organic content efforts into a newsroom-worthy conversation? We are looking for someone to lead our small but mighty social media and editorial content team, capable of creating and executing global editorial strategies. This role will sit on the Corporate Affairs leadership team and will be a key voice in shaping the overall Corporate Affairs strategy.

In this position, you’ll 

Lead the organic social media team, and run a high-performing content engine to support our corporate, cultural and consumer storytelling. Create our corporate content, by turning our corporate narratives into compelling writing and visual assets. Collaborate with the Executive Comms team to shape and support the social presence of senior leaders, particularly on LinkedIn. Have overall responsibility for strategy, tone, and reputation across our owned online content and social media channels. This includes supporting the consumer social media manager in your team to set content pillars and consumer tone of voice, determining crisis strategy and responses, and writing and managing high-stakes output. Use external trends and audience insights to inform content strategy and broader business decisions, ensuring relevance. Be a key member of the corporate affairs leadership team, contributing to the overall external narrative and strategy for Vinted, and supporting Corporate Affairs operations and processes. Interface with senior stakeholders, including C-level, and work cross-functionally with Brand Marketing, Influencer Marketing, Public Affairs, External Communications, Employee Brand and Sustainability to create a cohesive external story. Define clear objectives, KPIs, and a measurement framework to track performance and optimize content output, and manage reporting to demonstrate ROI. Manage resources, including overseeing agency and freelancer relationships, ensuring consistent messaging and best-in-class execution, and leveraging AI for efficiency. Push us to think differently and more creatively in how and where we tell our stories. 

About You

You are an excellent writer and communicator, you can turn info into compelling copy and visual content. You know how to tell a story. You have a deep sense of the external conversation and cultural context in which Vinted operates. You use this to ensure that our strategies land and are culturally relevant and sensitive in tone. You can translate the business strategy into a measurement framework for your team, and use KPIs and metrics to demonstrate ROI and progress against your goals. You have experience managing senior stakeholders, advising on high-stakes communications, and have demonstrated excellent judgement in these situations. You have experience in managing people, and creating a supportive environment to get the best out of your team. You possess fluency in English, both written and verbal. This is essential for creating engaging content, clear messaging, and effective audience interaction. Proficiency in any additional European languages is a plus. You are confident using data and insights to measure performance, iterate on content, and inform broader strategy. You bring a strong sense of cultural awareness and creativity, with an eye for content that earns attention and drives conversation. For a role like this, we ideally look for someone with 6+ years of experience in newsrooms, editorial roles, social media or digital marketing roles. Consumer sector experience is a plus. 

Please include examples of stories or content that you created or commissioned with your application.

Work perks 

The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme25 working days of holidayNewest MacBook modelsMental and emotional health support through the Mindletic appHome office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furnitureA daily lunch allowancePrivate health insuranceFrequent team-building eventsA personal monthly budget for shopping on VintedThe opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workationA dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted 

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. jobs.title: SEO Director
jobs.description:
At Jellyfish, we believe in the power of diverse perspectives and inclusive collaboration. We welcome individuals who excel in collaborative, varied teams and value the unique contributions that each person.

Jellyfish is a global digital marketing agency; a unique fusion of tech enthusiasts, creative minds, and media and data experts all united to empower our clients along their digital journey. Our commitment to embracing diverse perspectives fuels our innovation and strategies that challenge the status quo, reinvent media activation, and craft influential stories for our global clients and their customers. Join us in shaping a future where business growth and personal fulfilment go hand in hand.



Job Description

Reporting to our SEO Vice President, you will create impact within an international and senior Earned Media department. We take pride in our open approach to remote work and our use of the latest AI and automation tools that keep us ahead of the curve.

You'll contribute to the delivery of advanced SEO strategies across four clients in the real estate, home furniture, travel, and e-retail sectors. Leading technical SEO programmes and guiding a high-performing team, you'll collaborate across departments to achieve organic growth and boost online visibility. At Jellyfish, we are committed to promoting professional growth, supporting you with formal training in areas like analytics and AI, and informal learning through our SEO knowledge-sharing sessions and internal Wiki.

Your primary responsibilities will include:

Develop and implement comprehensive SEO strategies tailored to our clients' goals, covering technical SEO, content optimisation, and link building.Lead technical SEO programmes, ensuring best practices are applied to enhance site performance and search visibility.Conduct in-depth technical SEO audits to resolve issues related to site architecture, crawlability, and indexation.Be the main contact for our clients, managing communications and addressing queries from senior partners.Oversee the creation and management of SEO roadmaps, ensuring delivery of projects within budget constraints.Use data pipelines and cloud technologies to automate performance tracking and reporting.Mentor and support a team of SEO Executives, promoting a culture of learning and professional development.Stay up to date with industry trends and algorithm updates, adjusting strategies to maintain SEO performance.

Qualifications

Fluency in both English and French.At least 5 years of SEO experience with large-scale websites.Comfortable working directly with clients, explaining technical findings, presenting strategies and justifying recommendations, sometimes to non-technical partners.Knowledge of web technologies and their impact on organic performance.Experience managing site migrations and resolving associated SEO challenges.Familiar with tools such as Screaming Frog, Oncrawl, Botify, Semrush or SEObserver for conducting audits and optimising performance.Proficient in working with large datasets, using platforms like Google Analytics 4 or Google Search Console.Comfortable using automation tools like make.com and LLM like ChatGPT.When faced with a problem, you collaborate with the appropriate people to evaluate different options find practical solutions.You come up with unique ideas and experiment with new methods and technologies to solve complex issues.You show empathy and adapt your approach to connect with individuals from diverse backgrounds and experiences.Note: We emphasise skills, expertise and behavioural attributes over years of experience and traditional degrees. If you want to join our collaborative team, we invite you to apply today with your resume in English.



Additional Information

Join Jellyfish and experience a workplace where we prioritise your growth, celebrate your contributions, and empower you to tailor your work environment to suit your needs.

💰 Reward: You'll be eligible to join our discretionary annual bonus scheme.

💫 Custom Work Environment: Work remotely for up to 60% of your days and shape your day between 8am. and 6:30pm with flexible working hours.

📈Growth, Your Way: Accumulate one paid day each month (2 hours per week) for self-development and access to Jellyfish Learn.

👪 Family Support: Enjoy 14 weeks of paid leave for primary caregivers and 4 weeks of paid leave for secondary caregivers. We also provide £1000 (or equivalent) towards ourses for returning primary caregivers to support your transition back into work.

Unfortunately, there has been an increase in fake recruiters impersonating Jellyfish and unlawfully using our brand name. If you are unsure if an email with a job offer you have received is genuinely from Jellyfish, or if you suspect any fraudulent activity, please report it to talentacquisition@jellyfish.com.

jobs.title: Head of Marketing & Growth
jobs.description:
Pass App is building the future of consumer finance: an AI-powered crypto platform where making money is easier than ever before. Our mission is to unlock the financial value in crypto that is today too complex and out of reach for most people — and make it accessible to the masses.
We’re looking for a crypto-native leader to join as our Head of Growth & Marketing. Someone who lives in the culture and also knows how to scale a consumer app. Someone who can meme with the best of them, but also build funnels that convert. Someone who can coach and inspire a team, but also roll up their sleeves and drive growth hands-on.
🎯 Your missionYour north star is to generate attention and turn it into happy users. Every experiment, campaign, and story should serve that goal. You’ll lead and grow a world-class growth and marketing team, while setting the strategy and driving execution end to end.
🗂️ What you’ll doTeam leadership: Lead, mentor, and level up a small but exceptionally talented marketing team — acting as both coach and hands-on contributorGrowth ownership: Drive the full funnel — acquisition, activation, retention, referral, and revenue — through organic and paid channels GTM strategy: Own go-to-market planning and execution for new product launches, features, and campaignsNarrative & positioning: Craft a narrative that resonates with both crypto natives and mainstream users, positioning Pass App as the leader of a new AI-powered financial categoryData & KPIs: Define, own, and communicate growth and marketing KPIsProduct collaboration: Partner with product, design, and engineering on in-app growth loopsStrategic partnerships: Build partnerships with protocols, platforms, and projects to accelerate growth and distribution
🎒 What we’re looking forExperience: 10+ years of experience in consumer growth and marketing (fintech, gaming, social, or crypto)Crypto-native: You understand CT dynamics, KOLs, communities, memes, DeFi, and tokenomicsLeadership: You’ve built and led small, high-performing teams — balancing leadership with hands-on executionProven growth: You have a track record of driving growth in a consumer productFull-stack marketer: You’re comfortable running experiments across community, content, paid UA, lifecycle, partnerships, and brandHybrid thinker: You move seamlessly between funnel analytics, brand storytelling, and everywhere in betweenBuilder mindset: You’re scrappy and fast-moving but also think in systems that compound over timeOwnership: You see growth as your mandate end-to-end, from creative campaigns to product loops
✨ Bonus superpowers0 to 1 scaling: Experience taking a company or product from early stage to product-market fit and beyondNetwork: Connections with KOLs, crypto media, or a large social following that can amplify distributionToken track record: Experience launching and marketing a token, including crafting a narrative, distribution, and adoptionWallet experience: Direct experience driving growth or marketing for a crypto wallet productThought leadership: Public speaking or thought leadership experience to represent the company in media, podcasts, or on stage
🌍 How we workWe’re a remote-first team spread across the world. Working across time zones pushes us to communicate clearly, keep context open, and move quickly without unnecessary friction. Our working hours center around European time zones, with enough overlap to connect with US hours for collaboration. We trust people to take ownership, make decisions, and deliver outcomes, while staying aligned through a mix of real-time teamwork and async communication.
Our culture is grounded in a few values that shape how we show up every day: ownership, speed, clarity, craft, curiosity, and mission. We believe in acting like founders, shipping fast, keeping things simple, sweating the details, staying open to new ideas, and always remembering why we’re here — to unlock the value of crypto for everyone.
🎁 Perks & benefitsOwnership: Meaningful token allocation so you share directly in the upside you’re helping createVacation: 25 vacation days per year Learning: Annual education budget to invest in your growthFlexibility: Flexible work schedule so you can balance life and work on your termsRetreats: Annual team retreats in amazing locations — not corporate offsites, but trips you’ll actually look forward to
🙌 Join usYou’ll be building at the frontier of AI, crypto, and consumer finance. That means no playbooks, no best practices, no old ways of doing things. You’ll own growth from the ground up and help define how millions of people interact with money and grow wealth.
If you want massive upside and the chance to help create a category that reshapes global finance, this is the place to be. Join us!

jobs.title: Growth & Strategy Manager
jobs.description:
Are you ready to shape the future of leading events across Europe? Join one of the world’s Top-20 exhibition organisers and take the lead in driving growth across the French market.

At Easyfairs, we organize 110+ market-leading events across 16 countries, manage 8 venues across Europe, and have been recognized 7 years in a row as one of Best Managed Companies (Belgium) by Deloitte. We’re also proud recipients of “Great Place to Work” awards across all our key markets.

Your mission: 

As Growth & Strategy Manager France, you are responsible to grow Easyfairs’ presence in the French market. You’re directly shaping the region’s strategy by working closely with senior leadership and event teams across Europe. You’ll act as key player in identifying growth opportunities (new launches, geo-cloning of events, M&A and growth strategies for existing events) across diverse industries our events serve — from manufacturing, healthcare to education, entertainment and more.

Why join us?

Play a leading role in the expansion and transformation of an innovative events portfolio.Spearhead new market launches, directly shaping the region’s business strategy.Detect market trends and transform them in new growth opportunities for our current portfolio Collaborate with high-performing teams across Europe, driving initiatives with autonomy and creativity.Join a global leader in events, known for bringing business communities together and delivering exceptional results.


Key Responsibilities:

Identify launch opportunities on the French market, based on deep competitive scans and white-space analysis, deep industry value chain analysis, growth trends across industriesOwn the launch process of new events end-to-end: Market research, validation of potential with customers, negotiations with event venues, implementation together with local event teamsProvide structured advice on growth strategies for existing eventsContribute to budgeting and P&L planning of our French businessEnsure executive-level presentations to executive-level boards on new launch proposals and growth strategies are clear, data-driven, and high-impactSupport in the development of our French presence by networking with key external stakeholders (e.g., sector associations, exhibition venues, press, local governments, key exhibitors)


Stakeholder Management:

Engage with external stakeholders such as sector associations, federations, opinion leaders, press, key exhibitors. 


Requirements:

3-5 years’ experience in corporate strategy/growth roles or strategy/management consultingA master’s degree in a business/analytical discipline preferred Excellent analytical, oral and written communication skills. Capacity to summarise market insights into actionable strategiesSkilled in making strategic recommendations at management levelA growth and can-do mindset, high degree of curiosity and ambition, collaborative spirit, and international mindsetProven ability to manage multiple projects, engage stakeholders, and deliver results.Fluency in English and French mandatory, strong command of PowerPoint & Excel is key 


We offer:

A great role to grow into a regional or global leadership position, with real responsibility, visibility, regular mentoring & trainings. Competitive package including performance-based end-year bonus, enhanced family pay (maternity/paternity), pension contribution & life insurance, partial remote working and moreA dynamic, entrepreneurial and award-winning culture that cares about sustainability, diversity, inclusion and psychological safetyA varied and stimulating role, with exposure to many industries and tasks, regular travel to events and internal workshops, and a fun, international work environment


If you're excited about working for us and have the skills and experience we're looking for, please go ahead and apply!

Who are we?

Easyfairs is a pan-European event company. We organise and host more than 200 events in 14 countries (Algeria, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland and the United Kingdom) and we manage eight venues in Belgium, the Netherlands and Sweden. Our passion is to bring business communities and communities of interest together. We strive to “easify” the life of our customers and increase the return on their investment of time and money through all-in formulas, advanced technology and a customer-centric approach. The Easyfairs Group employs 750 highly committed talents. Our commitment to excellence has been recognised several times. We were named Belgium’s “Entrepreneur of the Year®” in 2018 and Deloitte has named us a “Best Managed Company” six years running (2019-24). The company is ranked 11th in the list of the world’s leading exhibition companies.

If you're excited about working for us and have most of the skills/ experience we're looking for, please go ahead and apply! Here at Easyfairs, we are passionate about the power of fostering a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment for our team to thrive in. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

(1 heure)

1 jour de RTT par mois en plus des 25 jours de congés légauxNotre charte de télétravail hybride (1 jour de télétravail par semaine).Une carte Swile qui vous permettra à la fois de bénéficier de 11€/jour de tickets restaurant pris en charge à 50% par Ornikar, et de 42€/mois de remboursement transport pris en charge à 100% par OrnikarUn abonnement sport et bien-être GymlibUne assurance santé complémentaire avec AlanLa possibilité de passer votre permis gratuitementDes centaines de réductions et avantages via Leeto, partenaire de notre Comité Social ÉconomiqueL'accès à notre plateforme éducative Edflex pour continuer à vous former en parallèle de votre activité chez nous

Rejoignez-nous et contribuez à façonner l'avenir chez Ornikar.De même, si vous avez besoin d'un dispositif spécial à l'emploi ou d'une autorisation de travail sur le territoire français, faites-nous en part le plus rapidement possible pendant le processus de recrutement pour que les démarches administratives ne ralentissent pas votre arrivée chez nous.

Who We Are
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.
Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. jobs.title: Growth Marketing - Stripe Publishing
jobs.description:
Who we are

About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About Stripe Publishing

Stripe’s Publishing team makes books and magazines about economic, social, and technological progress. Our two main brands are Stripe Press, which sold over 300,000 books last year, and Works in Progress, an online magazine. Later this year, Works in Progress will launch a full print magazine with paid subscriptions. Stripe Press will begin selling its entire catalogue of books directly on its website, allowing for more experimentation in pricing, bundling, and reader engagement. While many of the ideas we explore are somewhat timeless, we are very much a startup operation: growing rapidly, experimenting and iterating, and holding high aspirations for what we can build.

What you’ll do

Your primary goal will be to grow the reach of Works in Progress and Stripe Press: a new and highly entrepreneurial role, with no preexisting gameplan. This includes growing Works in Progress’s audience online, selling Stripe Press books and Works in Progress print subscriptions, and maximising the reach of other outputs like short films and podcasts. You’ll develop and execute a growth strategy across both brands, identifying the right mix of paid and organic tactics, strategic partnerships, and novel channels. Whether it’s getting mentions in top-tier newsletters, building a high-performing referral program, or running partnerships with conferences, you’ll be responsible for designing what works and delivering results—while upholding and strengthening Stripe Publishing’s distinctive taste.

Responsibilities

Run growth, partnerships, and marketing for Works in Progress and Stripe Press.Produce and implement a clear growth plan that covers who we want to reach, which channels we’ll use, how much we’ll spend, and how we’ll judge success.Experiment with different channels (events, newsletters, paid ads, podcast appearances, SEO and LLM search, etc.) and optimise spending over time based on whatever proves most effective.Develop and implement a social strategy designed to increase reach and audience share with thoughtful posts in line with our overall taste. Seek out and run partnerships—such as conferences, newsletters, or joint campaigns—that put our books and magazines in front of new readers.Run launches and special offers, including price tests, limited‑time deals, and cross‑promotions between the magazine and the books.Track results and share updates and lessons after each big push.Maintain basic marketing tooling (email platform, ad pixels, analytics tags) and keep data clean for reliable reporting.Set up renewal and retention efforts, like welcome emails, auto‑renew flows, merch and other perks, to keep subscribers and repeat book buyers.Create a simple referral program so happy readers can share and earn rewards, and track how it performs.Make sure our articles, book excerpts, and interviews rank well in search and keep drawing organic traffic.Prepare and manage the yearly marketing budget, adjusting month by month as results come in.Find, recruit and manage any external contractors or agencies required for all of the above.


Who you are

We need someone who has experience in growing the online audience of media brands that are similar to Works in Progress and Stripe Press, as well as selling things on the internet in creative ways. Experience in the book publishing industry is not essential. But we are open-minded about what the right skillset looks like: someone with experience in marketing and business development for a fast-growing consumer-focused startup may have the right skills and experience, if they know how to apply them here. You should know when to trust your gut and when to look at the data, and be able to lead this workstream by yourself.

We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements

5+ years experience in a senior growth-focused role for a startup, ideally (but not necessarily) in media, with a strong track record.A strong affinity for Works in Progress and Stripe Press, including a passion for economic growth and technological progress.


Preferred Qualifications

 2+ years working on online growth for a media brand, with a strong track record.


In-office expectations

Office-assigned Stripes in most of our locations are currently expected to spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This expectation may vary depending on role, team and location. For example, Stripes in our Bucharest, Romania site have an 80% in-office expectation, and those in Stripe Delivery Center roles in Mexico City, Mexico and Bengaluru, India work 100% from the office. Also, some teams have greater in-office attendance requirements, to appropriately support our users and workflows, which the hiring manager will discuss. This approach helps strike a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility when possible.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is £75,200 - £112,800. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings (“OTE”) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicant’s location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.

jobs.title: Marketing Science Lead
jobs.description:
At Vio.com, we believe travel should be effortless, inspiring, and fair. As one of the world’s fastest-growing travel tech platforms, we help millions of users compare prices across 100+ booking sites to find the perfect stay at the best price, globally. Operating in over 100 markets, we are on a mission to reshape the way people discover and book accommodation through technology, transparency, and trust.As our Marketing Science Lead - Measurement & Attribution, you'll architect and implement Vio.com's unified measurement framework during a critical growth phase. You'll build the scientific foundation that enables precise budget allocation and marketing optimisation across our global, multi-channel ecosystem. You'll be responsible for designing and executing a comprehensive attribution and incrementality framework and operate at the intersection of statistical modelling, experimental design, and marketing science, creating the single source of truth for marketing performance measurement.This role is ideal for a measurement scientist ready to solve complex attribution challenges and build scalable measurement foundations for a fast-scaling global travel brand.
What you will do:Design and implement a unified Multi-Touch Attribution (MTA) and incrementality framework including holdout experiments and geo-based testsImplement Marketing Mix Modelling (MMM) approaches to understand channel interactionsRun systematic experiments to calibrate attribution models and validate measurement accuracyBuild experimental frameworks that enable continuous testing and learning across marketing channelsDesign frameworks to measure view-through conversions and assisted conversions across the customer journey and account for all touchpoints in the conversion pathDevelop infrastructure to ensure clean, reliable data feeds for attribution analysisDevelop actionable insights that directly inform budget allocation decisions across the marketing funnel
Who you are:6+ years building attribution and measurement frameworks for fast-scaling consumer tech, travel, or e-commerce companies at significant scaleExpert-level proficiency in Multi-Touch Attribution (MTA) methodologies and implementationDeep experience with Marketing Mix Modelling (MMM)Strong background in experimental design and executing lift experiments, holdout tests, and geo-based experimentsExperience building post-view attribution infrastructure and impression-based measurement systemsStrong understanding of digital marketing channels, attribution challenges, and measurement limitationsExperience leading measurement teams or training analysts on attribution methodologies
Why join us now?We are one of the most innovative and fastest-growing accommodation booking platforms in the world today, having grown our bookings 30x between 2017 and 2024, and catering to the needs of over 100 million unique visitors worldwide each year. We do that by harnessing the power of advanced algorithms and an innovative suite of power features, and managed to overcome the corona crisis remarkably fast;The mobile applications (iOS and Android) we launched in 2023 are already a big success, reaching 2.5 million installs with great customer reviews, as we are beginning to build Vio.com as the brand for value-seeking travellers worldwide;We are a passionate and diverse team of tech enthusiasts and creatives with a commitment and focus on the traveler above all else - and it shows in our industry-leading TrustPilot score;We place huge importance on rewarding our employees for the value they generate by giving Stock Appreciation Rights to all employees.
Do you want to know if Vio.com is the right place for you? Find out by reading about the attitude that thrives at Vio.com.
What we offer:Plenty of chances to learn and grow within an open, diverse culture which promotes knowledge sharing, trust and transparency;A great compensation package, perks and benefits (including significant stock appreciation rights);Flexible time off (take as many holidays as you need) and a chance to work remotely;You will be part of a highly international team that enjoys working, eating and playing together in one of the best office locations in Amsterdam;We value good food and offer catered lunches from various cuisines, great coffee, ice-cream in the fridge and the occasional barbecue in our garden;We enjoy getting together to celebrate our wins with company events in Amsterdam and abroad;A budget for your dream home office;Access to free mental health support via OpenUp. L’une des grandes forces de GaiaConnect réside dans sa communauté de mentors (300 mentors de l’impact) et ses alumni (400 talents en transition), ainsi que ses partenaires (JobsThatMakeSense, Cap Positif, Jumanji 2030, B Corp).
Où nous en sommes :
En quelques mois, GaiaConnect est devenue la plus grande communauté de mentorat dédiée à la transition vers les métiers de l'impact positif avec plus de 300 mentors bénévoles couvrant divers secteurs tels que l'agriculture, la RSE, le marketing responsable, le monde associatif, l'économie circulaire ou la réinsertion. GaiaConnect a déjà facilité 2,000 rencontres.
Notre approche unique de mentorat personnalisé et abordable (129€) a permis à 63% des mentoré·es de transitionner vers un emploi à impact en moins de six mois.
Nous testons actuellement trois autres solutions complémentaires : en amont, des dîners entre inconnu·es engagé·es ou cherchant à s’engager dans la même ville; en aval, des ateliers RH pour booster son CV impact et une offre d’abonnement à des offres de job à impact personnalisées.
La communauté GaiaConnect est dynamique et en pleine croissance. En plus des sessions individuelles avec nos mentors, nous animons aussi des rencontres hebdomadaires, des webinaires mensuels, des apéros ponctuels, sommes présent·es à des salons et offrons un accès à notre communauté en ligne. Nous sommes également actif·ves sur les réseaux sociaux, partageant des témoignages inspirants et des conseils pratiques pour ceux et celles qui cherchent à s'orienter vers des carrières à impact positif. Mais on peut faire beaucoup mieux… et c’est pour cela qu’on a besoin de toi !
Notre équipe:
GaiaConnect est une entreprise créée en Août 2023 qui a adopté les statuts de l’ESS, et est soutenue par la BPI. Ses actionnaires actuels sont Jumanji 2030 et Benjamin Mercier.
Bien qu'étant une “startup”, notre projet est avant tout de développer une entreprise à la croissance saine et durable, portée par des valeurs environnementales fortes, et guidée par une équipe épanouie. Nous sommes sur la voie d’une certification B Corp.
Nous faisons partie de Jumanji 2030 (B Corp pending), un startup studio qui cherche à réinventer nos modes de vie dans les limites planétaires en créant des entreprises porteuses d’espoir. Jumanji 2030 opère comme un fondateur “full-time” hybride via son équipe de 6 personnes et ses dizaines de bénévoles.
Le capitaine de GaiaConnect est Benjamin Mercier : Profil international spécialisé en data analytics (ex VP Analytics chez Barclays), puis entrepreneur tech et en entrepreneuriat social, Ben a pris la direction de GaiaConnect il y a 18 mois. On a hâte que tu le rencontres pour échanger sur vos visions de ce que peut devenir GaiaConnect en alliant vos compétences !
Vos missions
Ton rôle :
Nous recherchons l'entrepreneur.e qui saura complémenter notre équipe notamment sur les sujets de marketing, partenariats et communauté. C’est un rôle très entrepreneurial, pas de place pour un·e stratège uniquement, il faut se sentir bien dans l'opérationnel et être prêt·e à mettre les mains dans le compost.
Développer et exécuter des stratégies marketing : concevoir et mettre en œuvre des stratégies marketing pertinentes qui amplifient notre message et attirent de nouveaux talents-mentoré·es et partenaires.
Faire grandir notre réseau de partenaires et notre visibilité : c’est en faisant les bons partenariats que nous délivrerons pleinement notre mission. Cela prend du temps, et nécessitera ton expertise, ton réseau, et probablement que tu saches te mettre en avant.
Amplifier la construction et l’animation de notre communauté : créer des liens forts avec nos membres, organiser des événements inspirants, et faciliter des échanges enrichissants entre mentors et mentoré·es tout en cherchant à améliorer notre service.
Élargir et déployer : faire grandir notre impact à travers de nouvelles initiatives stratégiques.
Promouvoir nos valeurs : communiquer notre engagement envers l'impact positif et les valeurs humaines, tant en interne qu'en externe.
Vos compétences
Ton profil :
GaiaConnect, c’est un fourmillement de bonnes énergies à faire grandir et à fédérer. Ton énergie et ta vision sont essentielles pour apporter une perspective fraîche et inspirante à notre mission de changement positif. Te sens-tu capable de diffuser toute cette énergie positive?
Es-tu prêt·e ? Raconte-nous pourquoi tu te sens pertinent·e !
Es-tu la bonne personne pour ce rôle clé chez GaiaConnect?
Pour nous, ce qui définit les meilleur·es leaders dans un environnement de startup, c'est l'attitude et les valeurs. Tu devras faire preuve d'un optimisme à toute épreuve, d'une énergie positive, d'un courage persévérant et d'une grande ouverture d'esprit.
Nous voulons travailler avec des personnes qui ont une réelle ambition pour la planète. Si tu envisages de consacrer toutes tes compétences à un changement positif, nous te montrerons que c'est possible. Attention, nous allons aussi te demander de pouvoir te projeter sur plusieurs années d’engagement.
Ta candidature
À maintes reprises, des études ont montré que les femmes ne postulent à un emploi que si elles répondent à 100 % des exigences, alors que les hommes postulent s'ils répondent à 60 % des exigences.
Mesdames, n'hésitez pas, postulez maintenant !
Nous sommes un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l'égalité des chances et nous ne pratiquons aucune discrimination à l'encontre d'un·e candidat·e à l'emploi.
Le recap:

Nous recherchons un·e cofondateur·trice prêt·e à s’engager pour le développement et le succès de ce projet et donc prêt.e à être le.la leader d’une équipe et prendre des décisions importantes.
Tu es un·e entrepreneur·e dans l’âme.
Tu es orienté·e action, solution et résultats.
Tu as un réel engagement sur les sujets d’impact positif.
Tu t’y connais vraiment en marketing et communauté, et tu te sens proche de la mission de GaiaConnect.

Avoir une expérience dans le secteur des RH/talents ou s’approchant sera définitivement un plus.
Ta Rémunération
Une part au capital de GaiaConnect au niveau d’un.e “late founder” ++
Rémunération : à l'heure actuelle, les revenus de GaiaConnect ne permettent pas de te payer un salaire. L'objectif est d'y arriver rapidement ensemble ! Nous sommes prêts à discuter des modalités ensemble.
A savoir : 40% de l'entreprise sont déjà réservés pour l'équipe future.
La charge de travail
C’est de l’entrepreneuriat. Tu auras de la charge mentale, des coups de bourre etc. Ce n’est pas pour tout le monde, il faut s’y préparer.
Avantages
Le (presque) full-remote chez GaiaConnect
Aujourd’hui Benjamin est situé à Bordeaux, et l'équipe de Jumanji entre Biarritz, Toulouse et Paris. Nous sommes en contact quotidien, et nous nous voyons toutes les 3 semaines environ.
Nous recherchons en priorité une personne proche de ces villes (Sud Ouest); ou à minima quelqu’un qui est à l'aise pour prendre le train régulièrement.
Enfin, Jumanji organise tous les mois des sessions visio entre startups, et tous les 3 mois des meetups avec toute l’équipe en France, et les lieux changent à chaque fois.
Processus
Nous recherchons quelqu'un avec qui on va développer une entreprise. La plupart des personnes avec qui Jumanji le fait ont d’ailleurs déjà monté une entreprise avant. Il faut donc apprendre à bien se connaître !

Entretien Fit & Culture avec Marine, Talent Head (45min à 1h).

Ensuite... autant de calls que nécessaire si on a un fit, et on se voit IRL.

Si on avance avec toi :

Échange avec un·e Advisor et/ou Investisseur 30 min.
1 ou 2 Reference call(s) - soit prêt·e à fournir des références! ;-).

jobs.title: Chargé(e) Marketing MERCASTO
jobs.description:
Présentation de l’École Supérieure de Physique et de Chimie Industrielles de la Ville de Paris (ESPCI Paris)
L’ESPCI Paris-PSL
L’ESPCI Paris – PSL (École Supérieure de Physique et de Chimie Industrielles de la Ville de Paris) est une école d’ingénieurs généraliste qui forme, depuis 1882, des ingénieurs de rupture, adaptables et créatifs, dotés d’un solide bagage théorique et expérimental, conscients des enjeux de la société.
Elle est intégrée à un centre de recherche reconnu internationalement en physique, chimie et biologie (500 publications par an). Elle est connue pour sa capacité à transformer les connaissances issues de la recherche fondamentale en innovations de rupture (2 brevets par mois, 3 start-ups par an).
Distinguée par 6 Prix Nobel, elle accueille 400 élèves-ingénieurs, 530 chercheurs (dont 250 doctorants et 100 post-doctorants) dans 10 unités mixtes de recherche et environ 100 agents des fonctions support de la recherche et de l’enseignement.
Depuis sa création, l’ESPCI n’a cessé de mobiliser ses forces et compétences au service de sujets sociétaux majeurs et de défendre l’importance de la science au service de la société. L’environnement, la solidarité, la santé, l’accès et l’ouverture au savoir sont des enjeux que l’ESPCI s’est engagée à prendre en compte dans son quotidien tout en contribuant à les faire avancer. L’ESPCI défend l’égalité des chances et promeut la diversité sociale. Elle encourage et valorise l’engagement, notamment associatif, de ses étudiants.
Notre établissement fait partie de l'Université Paris Sciences & Lettres. Numéro 1 du classement mondial des jeunes universités publié par le Times Higher Education, PSL figure aussi dans le top 50 des meilleures universités mondiales (Shanghai, Times Higher Education, QS, CWUR).
L’ESPCI est engagée dans un vaste projet de rénovation de son campus parisien qui fera d’elle un des sites scientifiques les plus modernes de Paris.
L’ESPCI est lauréate de l’appel à projet « Compétences et métiers d’avenir France 2023 » dans le domaine de la décarbonation de l’industrie incarné par le projet MERCASTO (Mesurer, Réduire, Capter, Stocker les émissions industrielles de CO2).

Missions et responsabilités :
Le, la candidate sera chargé(e) d’élaborer une stratégie de communication pour faitre connaître les avancées du projet et des parties prenantes sur différents sujets (Mastère, formations, etc).Le, la candidate devra aider à l’élaboration des supports de diffusion et à l’organisation d’évènements sur le projet MERCASTO.Le, la candidate veillera à la cohérence de l’image du projet et animera les réseaux sociaux et le(s) site(s) web avec la direction de la Communication.Le, la candidate proposera des améliorations, des ajustements et de nouvelles idées pour développer la communication autour du projet MERCASTO.Le, la candidate travaillera en collaboration avec la cheffe de projet MERCASTO afin d’assurer la cohérence et l’éfficacité des actions marketing mises en œuvre.

ProfilFormation requise (ou diplôme) :Nous recherchons un chargé(e) marketing ayant un diplôme Bac+4/5 en école de communication, grande école ou école d’ingénieur. Une ou plusieurs expériences en marketing ou en communication sont souhaitées.Le/la candidate doit posséder la maîtrise du Pack Office et doit faire preuve d’une bonne aisance rédactionelle. Le/la candidate doit être force de proposition dans ses missions quotidiennes et aimer collaborer en équipe.La maîtrise de l’anglais est nécessaire.Poste à pourvoir à compter du : dès que possible.Les candidatures (CV, lettre de motivation) sont à transmettre par courriel à emma.livolsi@espci.fr avec en copie recrutement@espci.frAdresse : 10, Rue Vauquelin 75005 ParisMoyens d’accès en transports en commun : Métro ligne 7 (Place Monge/Censier Daubenton) - RER B (Luxembourg) - Bus 21, 27 & 47 - 3 Vélib’ stations à proximité.

jobs.title: Technical Product Marketing Manager - Cybersecurity
jobs.description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.

We’re looking for a Technical Product Marketing Manager who combines deep technical understanding with strategic marketing expertise to develop go-to-market plans for our global security and compliance portfolio.

This is a hands-on, multidisciplinary, and dynamic position that requires working closely with product managers, engineering teams, and security experts to truly understand the technical capabilities of our offerings, and translate them into compelling positioning and content. You’ll also collaborate with the content team, sales, and other marketing functions to drive awareness, adoption, and growth.

The ideal candidate is a technologist at heart, someone who thrives on understanding how products work under the hood and is excited to communicate their value clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences. You’re motivated by ownership, driven by curiosity, and comfortable operating at the intersection of product and marketing. You love to get hands-on, solve problems, experiment, and build scalable marketing systems.

This role sits within the product marketing team and reports to the Product Marketing Lead

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What Your Day Will Look Like

Lead the go-to-market strategy and execution for Canonical’s range of security and compliance products, including messaging and positioningTrack the competitive landscape and emerging trends to define product differentiation and value driversCollaborate with engineering and product teams to understand product roadmaps, and customer use casesTranslate technical product capabilities into clear, differentiated messaging for key personas, including Executives, DevSecOps, and platform teamsOwn campaign and content planning for the security portfolio Use data and insights to iterate on demand generation strategies and optimize conversion throughout the funnelWork with other teams to plan events, webinars and support messaging for paid and social media promotion


What We Are Looking For In You

A passion for technology and open source—you get excited about innovation, software, and community-driven development.Strong storytelling skills—you know how to craft messaging that resonates with both technical and business audiences.Growth mindset—someone who thrives on experimentation, learning, and continuous improvement.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.


Nice-to-have Skills

Technical understanding of the Cybersecurity world Data-driven mindset, using insights to refine strategies and improve performance.Experience in product marketing for enterprise software, cloud, DevOps, or open-source solutions.Experience with demand generation, understanding how to translate GTM strategies into pipeline growth.Comfort working cross-functionally with product, sales, partners, and marketing teams.


What We Offer Colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in personPersonal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per yearAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveMaternity and paternity leaveTeam Member Assistance Program & Wellness PlatformOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleaguesPriority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

We're growing fast and we want YOU on to join our remote team. We're looking for bilingual (English AND Hebrew) social media experts who love jumping into online conversations, crafting content that connects, and keeping digital communities safe and welcoming.
